sentences.sContent: Which company do you work for?
I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.sCn: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.sContent: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.sCn: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.sContent: The company directors have awarded themselves a massive pay increase.
sentences.sCn: 公司的董事们给自己大幅加薪。

sentences.sContent: ...according to a new report from market research company Mintel...

...The company spent the last five years developing solar panels that are only about a quarter of inch thick and are strong enough to stand up to heavy highway traffic without breaking or making the roads more slippery...
...the roads will be built through joint efforts with the French road building company Colas and the National Institute of Solar Energy...
...it is sensible for the parents to spend more time on the company with their children...
...A company should find ways to innovate not just in products but also in functions...
...a real innovative company should develop an innovation culture and use it as a primary tool for success...
...What does the company Procter & Gamble owe its success to...
...to take a job in a company meets my desire of learning from practice and support my parents financially...
...investors' bets that a company will do even better in the future because of innovation...
...They were a company stuck in time...

phrases.pCn: 有限公司；（英）股份有限公司（等于limited-liability company）
上市公司，股票上市的公司
公司简介；公司概况；企业介绍

words.tran: 好交往的；友善的；适于做朋友的
伙伴的，同伴的；友爱的，友好的

trans.tranOther: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services
